comment: While this class was not hard, it involved a ton of writing with weekly discussion posts and writing assignments. I feel as if she sometimes graded harder than need be on certain assignments, but I still received a good grade overall. She's not easy to get into contact with, and term paper for the class lacks an appropriate rubric.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Super easy course. Weekly discussion post with all the information in the book and simple weekly internet activity. One midterm and one final, two quizzes. All online. If you can keep up with the work, it is an easy a. Bumped my grade up to an A with out me asking.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took the 3360 online.  Questions on tests are extremely specific. You have to have the book-alot of reading. Many essay questions.  A paper a week (on each chapter) and weekly discussions.  Not very quick response time on questions and not exactly clear on feedback for tests. Very interesting subject loved the book, just hard to keep up.

I took her for vicrimiology my first online class! I done better than I expected. The class wsd easy, just tons of work but its very easy. 12 assignments and discussions, one peoject with essay. 2 test . you learn a lot from reading the book, assignments and classmates. This class was much more in depth than going to a classroom. I enjoyed it :-)

Love! Her class is AWESOME and SUPER EASY!!!  midterm and final are lengthy and essayish. 20 essay questions with 4 hours to take. Other than that theres just weekly discussions and papers. I made 100s on ALL my papers :) YOU NEED THE BOOK!

This class was...okay. Lewis is an easy grader, but her class is not very stimulating nor interesting. The online class is very tedious and you need to be disciplined in order to do well. Weekly 2-3 page papers, weekly discussion posts and a mid-term and a final, both essay, and 10 questions each.

Dr. Lewis is an exceptional professor.  I have taken two of her classes now and have learned more from her teaching style then I have from some of the in class courses.  Yes it is an online class so you have to read and write papers - come on if you don't want to work for your grade then don't take her class. But if you do you won't be disappointed

For a criminal justice professor she is really nice and knowledgeable. I took two classes with her and I learned a lot. Weekly quiz, discussion, and assignment. She also has a final and midterm but it is not bad at all. She is very laid back and cool. Hands down she is better than all CJ or Sociology profs at KSU.
Dr. Emerson is a passionate teacher and she cares for all of her students. The class is easy if you read and do the assignment. She really knows her stuff.

Took this online and just as you would expect a lot of reading, assignments, discussions. Weekly quizzes on reading,midterm,final and service project.  Do not expect any input from professor at all.  Is not prompt in responses to questions.  I recommend taking this course in classroom - it would be more interesting.  Overall: Was a disappointment
